intro: Hieracium canum subsp. charadraeum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It is a common weed in agricultural areas and can form dense colonies.
